body.p: Graduated from Kenyon College in Ohio in 1840, and from Union College of Schenectady, New York in 1842, whereupon he returned to Frankfort. Read law under T. B. Monroe, judge of the United States district court, and Charles S. Morehead, who would later become the 20th Governor of Kentucky. Admitted to the Bar in 1844. Elected County Attorney in 1852. Elected Commonwealth Attorney for the Eighth Judicial Circuit in 1856.
